intro: Coprosma grayana, commonly known as the silver coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has dark green, glossy leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery coating, giving it its common name. It thrives in coastal and forested areas, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Coprosma grayana is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate coastal conditions.
